article_title: Two halves of California have wide gap in health costs
article_text:
Expenses tend to be higher in north state than in south

C-section can cost $11,000 more in Sacramento Valley than in L.A.

Comparison tools are making price tags more visible; good insurance can drop price to zero

article_metadata.news-keywords: Covered California, premium rates, health care costs, R. Dudley Adams, Consumer Reports, UCSF Center for Healthcare Value, health care comparison tool, Dave Jones, state Dept. of Insurance
article_metadata.description: When it comes to health care costs, it’s clear: Where you live matters. And in California, the gap is especially sharp between the north and south.
article_metadata.title: Two halves of California have wide gap in health costs | The Sacramento Bee
